selectedVerses.text: At the noise of horseman and archer every city takes to flight; they enter thickets; they climb among rocks; all the cities are forsaken, and no man dwells in them.
They leap upon the city, they run upon the walls, they climb up into the houses, they enter through the windows like a thief.
"If they dig into Sheol, from there shall my hand take them; if they climb up to heaven, from there I will bring them down.
